bow: doing the math being stay at home mom hey so have been crunching numbers and have essentially figured out that am making 88 day before taxes to be away from my baby for 10 hours day feel like it is worth it **has anyone else crunched the numbers is it worth it to keep working at this point has anyone here started staying at home and regretted it loved it ** not sure if am ready to take the plunge here is post from my blog that shows how came up with that 88 day number link http maureenmacdonald blogspot com 2013 01 maths html before having my baby made 40k pretaxes was away from home from 7:30 am to 7:15 pm everyday every daycare found was open no later than 6:30pm paid 100 month for parking and the childcare found but was 100 in love with was 40 day so 800 month there nearly half my income spent already the benefit of actually seeing my child far outweighed the extra 1000ish month also breastfeed and had terrible luck pumping we definitely would have had to switch to formula since would have been able to keep up and that would be an extra cost we went down to one vehicle my so took on extra on call time each month and we do eat out as much also started back to school for my master with local university online never would have been able to do so if was still at my previous job yes it can be isolating we are in terrible neighborhood as far as walkability but that is soon changing as we are buying house that is miles from shops and the library getting out of the house saves my sanity another thing is if you intend on having another child before this one starts school you ll be paying for childcare for kids tl dr made more sense to stay home because of hours and money for me we knew from the get go that wanted to be stay at home mom had my baby and then started being at home after few months of overlap found out very quickly that while hated working full time while having kid at home needed balance from being at home all the time so work part time 10 12 hrs week the money that earn is wash with childcare but it gets me out of the house and allows me to use my degree love my baby dearly but love the time that she gets to spend with other adults and it allows me to come back refreshed and ready to play you can always make cuts in your family budget to make up for the 88 day frugal can help but you can not get back this precious time with your little one baby can become cheaper with cloth diapers homemade baby food and making toys from recyclables just let me know if you want any tips for frugal parenting it sounds like you ve already made up your mind if you can survive on one salary and still have little left over for the occasional date night sure you ll feel like it was the best decision you ever made ve been sahm for the entirety of my daughter almost three years and although sometimes feel like my brain is mush know that am the biggest influence in my daughter life and that makes me want to be the best person can be they grow so fast that the first two years are just marvel to watch them everyday but by three they benefit from playing with other kids personally did work weekends for about six months at one point but the stars aligned that those were the precise six months that my husband work kept having overnight and weekend jobs so pretty soon it was more stress than it was worth plan on going back to school and returning to the workforce when my daughter starts preschool if you can swing part time work from home job just for your sanity that might be the best option for baby and your happiness when my husband and found out we were pregnant with our second child we knew that we could even afford daycare for both the children with our first son we used to work alternating schedules so that we both worked full time but one of us was always home to watch our son it was exhausting and my husband and never got to see each other it really hurt our relationship for while our son is in preschool now while my husband and both work full time during the day but to add baby to the daycare it would literally take one of our entire month paychecks we both felt that was unacceptable and did want to go back to the stress of working different schedules my husband will be staying home once our baby is born in august and only make approximately 26 000 year it going to be rough but we both value our family and children much more than having extra money my husband and both knew that would be sahm once our daughter came made good money but he still made enough to support our family but the biggest factor was the time commitment was usually gone at work from 9am until 8pm could imagine only seeing my child couple hours in the morning if it was something that could be avoided that coupled with the fact that was looking for way out of my job anyway made it an easy decision for us it also important to ask yourself if you love your job does it make you happier better parent because you are so fulfilled by your career you ca boil it down to number and ask if its worth it or not if you have the means and wo miss the income then being sahm is pretty fantastic but it might mean lifestyle change more frugal way of living to keep your standards you will miss adult interaction and workday routine so if you make the plunge make sure to get involved in playgroups and cultivate good sahm network and keep something going to challenge you mentally whether you work part time from home or take up hobby class or something have yet to meet sahm who does love it sure posted it somewhere else but work 12 hours week pretax for daycare after taxes it probably something like 15 hours do know the math in my case think it for the best quite honestly tried the whole sahm thing and realized that while love my children and want to spend time with them ca spend 24 hours day with them they are getting so many more opportunities from daycare preschool than am able to offer alone my oldest is in yoga and spanish at preschool as well as being able to play with children his own age my youngest gets the opportunity to not be the youngest and play with kids that are bossing him around like big brother does those 25 paid hours week are worth it for us so we can pay some debt off and occasionally have date night love staying home love it but it is hard work and it big adjustment however will never regret having these years with my children there is no way would have made nearly enough money at my job to cover child care we knew that when we started ttc it not worth it for me thanks for your story am luckily within walking distance of both the library and grocery store do think ve had time to even pick up book since going back to work this hated my job and that made the decision much easier this is good point am thinking will start looking for part time job that can do without having to daycare more than once week your comment know that am the biggest influence in my daughter life really spoke to me feel like right now that is not the case but want it to be yeah with two kids it would really be question guess we have really decided when we are going to have yeesh 11 hours away from baby is hard am away from baby for 10 hours if you count lunch and commute it not just hours you are being paid lol definitely not actually have few friends who are sahms and before went back to work really enjoyed meeting up with them going back to work was hard for variety of reasons worried will regret it if do do hate my job but am pretty neutral about it stay because like my coworkers and the environment not because actually care about my work when was trying to decide if start staying home full time this was exactly the advice coworker gave me that and you find way to make it work financially if it means that much to you needless to say ve been home for year now and would go back unless we really found ourselves in dire straits when was working was lucky if made over 700 take home month working 40+ hours week commission job and was the one always working the slow hours no one else wanted to work stuck doing stocking ect the job blowed daycare in my area averages 800 1100 month only open from 9am 530pm only one in the area is open at night until 9pm primarily worked evening and weekend shift also only one daycare was open sundays and it was the one that was also open later at night so have to try and get my daughter into two different daycares to cover my shifts both daycares charge for the whole week whether your kid is there or not so end up having to pay out at minimum 1600 month so obviously daycare turned out to be never option for us my job ended up firing me at 8months pregnant anyways so job was an issue once she was born my so job can pay all of our bills food gas and everything else we need so he said it better for me to just stay home we do have extra spending money often but it has been an problem love being sahm more than anything now that we re going to be moving and dd is getting older ve been thinking of getting part time job but at the same time the thought kills me it sounds like you ve got your decision made you re already in great shape with those contacts then live 113 miles from family and our only friends who live nearby work lot so pretty isolated and start getting really stir crazy at times but were going to try moving back where our family is this summer ca wait having support system is really important not saying you ll have time to read if you stay home either unfortunately but library trips are good for socialization with story times and just free activity exactly if loved my job career or we really needed the money could have found way to make it work but after weighing our options the choice was clear deleted loved my job teaching in community college but love raising my kid more it worked out nicely for me that am able to stay on as an adjunct instructor so teach one night class or an online course but if had to choose one or the other only would definitely choose being with my kid full time love the job and am good at it but am the only mama and thus the best at it you talked about doing the math well if you have kids and choose to care for them until they enter school even if you space them years apart you are still only talking about 10 years of your life only 10 years out of your total life that really not even that much as the rabbi said nobody on his deathbed ever said wish would have spent more time at the office deleted my fiancee and have 10 month old daughter am stay at home mother make no income my fiancee has job and makes about 300 week we manage we do go out do eat out and we do spend money on things we do absolutely need do regret it at all sure would love new clothes to get my nails toes done get stylish hair cuts and colors but would way rather be at home with my little baby girl hope this helps you obviously *want* to stay home in which case you should do everything you can to make that happen however your calculation is bogus the true cost of staying home vs working would take into account lost pay increases and retirement benefits from staying home sahps do not earn social security so your retirement is taking hit there if your job offers retirement benefits like 401k matching you ll lose that then there the lost skills from being out of the job market most sahps who go back to work find that they are making less than when they left whereas if they stayed in they might have gotten raise or two not that any of this should change your mind my advice is to aim for compromise is there any work you could do from home to keep your skills fresh and earn few hundred dollars month newsflash my kid is in daycare and raise her also her biggest influence her dad works full time and also raises her and is huge influence as well drop the mommy war bullshit it just makes you look insecure with your own choices we are all doing hat we feel we need to do no need to insult somebody else to justify yourself sorry if you took offense at my post switched from full time pre baby to part time once my critter was born it had it ups and downs but leaving him in daycare just did make sense considering what would have been taking home for pay jeez someone pissed in your cheerios today if you took offense in her post then you must have some insecurities of your own everyone has different life and situation she was just asking for some advice currently sahm for our 15 month old and pregnant at 24 weeks with number went back to work in august until early october when was forced to quit babysitter abruptly quit without notice when was working loved it it was nice to be away and making money and the babysitter was super cheap but love being home with my son he everything to me if put him in daycare it between 400 600 month was only working 20 hours so it was even worth it he only little once and get the chance to see him grow each day trust you ll make great decision that works best for you and your family good luck stay home because it is literally cheaper than me working guess it gets little exhausting hearing do raise my kids it something people say without thinking sure but it just really myopic thing to say do begrudge anyone choices to work and stay home no need to rationalize it as superior choice that mothers who actually are parents make am not angry just annoyed guess am the exception here we can afford for me to stay home but choose to go to work everyday we have one child who is in very small private daycare that is also inexpensive yay for friends love my job and have incredible flexibility and benefits when considering my income vs costs of working figure only pulling in about 250 wk it the schedule and routine that love have always been much happier person by staying busy maternity leave nearly drove me crazy also appreciate all of my family time every second which afraid would take for granted if were stay at home mom have loads of respect for stay at home moms think its actually harder than working every individual family has to learn what works for them and am no longer disappointed in my self for not wanting to stay with my kids all day hope this helps to reflect some light on the other side there are also very valid reasons for continuing working even if there is ton left over my husband and starte out making the same amount stayed home and he kept working and he now just through staying at the same place for years makes twice as much and has full paid benefits if we separated would bear the brunt of that choice feel lot better knowing will be able support myself and have options even though we are in strong relationship we did the math and my fiance is now sahd sold my car since it was smaller he got out of active duty and joined the reserves one weekend month with two week drill once year he is amazing at it he is better suited for it than am though and for very important reasons his social network here is stable and local my friends live an hour away amp only get to see them once or twice month he is the epitome of patience with our son get stressed out the mortgage is in my name and make more than him losing his income was really burden our savings account is growing we have nice safety net we do want for anything our son is happy and why should he be daddy around to hold him whenever he wants and take him jogging and practice sign language with him we re loving it ve never been so happy in my life we take care of the chores together by the way when at work few to no chores get done and that fine was at home until our son was months old and it hard to juggle all those balls set aside days that are cleaning days or shopping days where you work together to get everything done it goes so much faster and it nice to spend that time together even though the tasks are menial take turns cooking and get pizza amp eat on paper plates every once in while so that nobody has to cook or clean up deleted your insecurities are showing big time she was being insulting or trying to one up anyone if she does feel like she the biggest influence in her child life that because of *her* circumstances 10 hours away from her kid during workdays leaving her *at best* an hour or two in the evenings plus weekends it says *absolutely nothing* about yours she was asking about the financial impact personal impact and for input from others she made no blanket statements about parenting there was zero smugness or air of superiority about her question or her responses so yeah you re the one who took the first shots in the mommy war bullshit and you re the one who looks insecure for getting mad that someone dared to even ask about it or feel differently than you deleted can understand that am honestly bit surprised that am feeling the way do think it is because feel jelous of the person who is currently watching my baby always enjoyed working and getting out of the house and these feeling are just starting to creep in was in the process of trying to find job when found out was pregnant with my 2nd child since we live in rural area the cost of gas+decent child care+car payment would mean that would actually lose money working once both girls are both in school full time 1st grade going to go back to college to become teacher so can spend summers holidays with them it hard some days would pay to go to work but would change thing have chosen to stay home because would essentially be paying everything earned to have her in daycare so we decided screw that and also love it and am able to save us lot of money because have the time to shop carefully and hang our laundry etc can you cut back day maybe to have little more time staying at home was not the fantasy imagined it to be my kids would have been happier seeing little less of happier me ve been sahm for 12 years and ve never regretted it like you anything do for work would have paid for childcare before my kids were in school now that they are it more important to their dad and me that at least one of us preferably both of us is available for them and their activities when grew up my parents were never involved in anything did and did want my kids to live that way when our kids were little was lucky to find great group of friends with kids the same ages as mine we spent at least three days week with this group either going on outings or just hanging out together at someone house once my kids were both in school started spending lot of time volunteering at their schools and still do ve been around and done so much that now sit on some committees for the school district as well as for their schools often think about what our family could do if we had more income however none of it is more important to our family than the time can spend with or for the kids besides if got job now would be able to have coffee or lunch or hikes with my friends like can now this am in this exact spot right now plan on staying with my job until the baby comes once we start trying lol but am unsure what to do after that do want to be rude and please do not feel like you need to answer me but how much does your husband make my mother is sahm and my father works its always worked out for them however am unsure my husband gets paid enough for me to stay home and like to know what the average would be on that ladies you re all allowed some input on about how much you think that would cost there your answer deleted envy stay at homes wish my family was in the financial position for me to be at home all the time but make more money than my husband luckily she is in daycare only twice week and with my parents two half days week am realtor so my schedule can be pretty flexible and can do lot of work from home but love to be able to take care of my baby and my home without stressing about doing an occupation from home too if you can swing it with your significant other do it was wondering if we hear situation where the traditional gender roles are reversed we have twins so the numbers for us are bit different that being said figured could always go back to work at some point but could go back in time and decide to stay home while they are babies while it would be fabulous to have my previous income my husband and both know that the stress of finding daycare drop offs pickups rushing home and our sometimes crazy commutes working in new york city was worth it immediately know can go back into the workforce when choose but right now am adoring this incredibly rewarding insanely nutsy and amazing job here in my own home love being home with my little guy when crunching the numbers had to consider the costs of daycare extra sick baby visits from daycare germs and extra time on unlearning bad behaviors although there are positive lessons that come from daycare too if you stay home you might breastfeed exclusively and save money there relactation can be established and made the move to diapers cloth diapers and love them compared to paper diapers they paid for themselves in two months moreover know my lo is getting the best care possible and is always safe do have to miss any of his wonderful moments or one of his sweet smiles may go back to work at some point and may work from home but for now my work is my home can tell you as an experience mom with some adult children and some young children that there was no amount of money that could replace the time have spent with them none you would have to make very significant income for it to make sense financially lot of young mothers know worry that their kids wo get to have all the stuff that the other kids do and that might be true but your kids have *you* and that means so much to them my sons who are teens tell me how much it means that am here when they get home from school it has been tight financially but honestly there is no new house or car or gadget or clothes that could make up for this time went to college worked before had kids and when my two oldest were young quit when my oldest was and never regretted day of it your guilt is showing no one judged you working mother often try to pull this and sorry but we re not buying it when your kids are in school you can work all day while they are there and put 100 of your income into retirement 401k etc it better investment financially and definitely emotionally for many people mean you re taking home an extra 1700ish in income each month which is significant amount for most families do base the huge decision on whether to stay at home or work on money though if it is an issue either option could be better for you or the kid depending on your personalities situation etc
